dashboard.title: Dashboard

tutorial.title: Tutorial
tutorial.desc: üìñ Take a quick look at the functions of Chaos Mesh Dashboard
tutorial.step1: Dashboard is an overview of Chaos Mesh, where you can observe the running status of all experiments.
tutorial.step2: Experiments manages all experiments, where you can perform various operations (pause, archive, update, etc.) on the experiment.
tutorial.step3: Events shows the events generated by all experiments.
tutorial.step5: You can start your first experiment from here.
tutorial.step6: Search provides multiple syntaxes to help you locate experiments or events quickly. You can try it after creating an experiment.
tutorial.step7: Here you can browse the respective experiments, events and archives by selecting different namespaces.
tutorial.step8: Predefined can store custom experiments for quick execution in the future.
tutorial.step9: üéâ Congratulations on completing all the tutorial steps! Click the blank space to exit.

dashboard.newbieDesc: ‚õë Quickly inject a fault from a simple experiment
dashboard.startAWorkflowDesc: Workflow allows you to organize multiple experiments to simulate more realistic failures
dashboard.startAScheduleDesc: Schedule allows you to run an experiment periodically
dashboard.predefinedDesc: üì¶ Store custom experiments here for quick execution

addToken.title: Add Token

tip.title: Use the following syntax to quickly locate workflows, schedules, experiments and archives:
tip.namespace: namespace:default xxx will search for workflows, schedules, experiments and archives with namespace default
tip.kind: kind:NetworkChaos xxx will search for schedules, experiments and archives with kind NetworkChaos
